While the potatoes are cooking, grill the beef patties in a hot gril for a couple of minutes each side. If using good steak mince, you can decide on the done level, otherwise, ensure that the patties are well cooked.

While the patties are grilling, toast the burger buns for a minute or 2.

Combine all the ingredients into the bun, except the fries, which are served on the side.

fields.title: Bistec a la Mexicana
fields.intro: Bistec à la Mexicana is one of those simple and very traditional beef dishes prepared in many Mexican homes. Thin-sliced beef in a fresh and zesty tomato sauce. Perfect with rice or warm tortillas!
fields.directions:
Mix the salt, pepper and garlic powder. Season the steak pieces and stir to coat evenly. Set aside.

In a large skillet, preheat 2-3 tablespoons of oil to medium heat for 2-3 minutes.

Sear the beef on all sides, stirring as needed, about 10 minutes. Add the onions, the garlic cloves and 1/2 of the slices of serranos. Add a pinch of salt and pepper. Saute for 2-3 minutes.

Add 3/4 of the diced tomatoes and Maggi sauce. Stir well to combine. Add another pinch of salt and pepper. Cover and reduce heat slightly.

Transfer the remaining diced tomato to the blender. Add 1/3 cup of water, oregano and a pinch of salt. Blend on high until smooth. Pour into skillet. Stir well to combine. When it comes to a simmer, taste for seasoning. Cover and continue cooking at a low simmer for 25 minutes. If it's too dry-looking, you could add a little more water. Garnish with remaining slices of serranos and chopped cilantro before serving.

fields.title: Avocado Penne
fields.intro: This Avocado Pasta with Herbs is so colorful, flavorful and healthy. It’s also easy to whip up in just 15 minutes, using only your food processor (and boiling the noodles). No other cooking required!
fields.directions:
In a large pot, cook pasta according to package directions, to al dente. Drain. Transfer pasta back into pot and set aside. Do not rinse.

Meanwhile (while cooking the noodles), in a food processor, add lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, avocados, basil, parsley, almond milk, sea salt, black pepper, crushed red pepper and nutritional yeast (if desired). Process until smooth and creamy. Note: you may need to stop and stir the sauce and blend again if ingredients get stuck to the side.

Add pasta to a large bowl. Then add the avocado sauce to the pasta and stir to blend well. The pasta will warm the sauce slightly, or you can heat over low heat on the stove until desired temperature (this pasta can also be eaten cold).

Top with cherry tomatoes and serve immediately (see notes below for storage instructions). This recipe makes 4 small servings (about 1 cup each). Add additional sea salt (Fleur de sel French salt is recommended), red pepper flakes, and/or nutritional yeast before serving, if desired.

fields.title: Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos
fields.intro: These Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos are baked until crispy and loaded with spicy red-hot flavor. Top them with a little vegan ranch dressing and additional hot sauce, and you’ll have yourself an absolutely addicting meal.
fields.directions:
Preheat oven to 425 F. Prepare a large baking pan covered with parchment paper.

In a medium bowl, add the butter, almond milk, hot sauce, and maple syrup. Stir with a whisk until blended. Add the garlic powder, paprika, and nutritional yeast. Next slowly add the all purpose flour, while whisking, until blended.

Prepare a dinner plate (or cutting board) with the panko breadcrumbs laid out in a thin layer.

Add all of the cauliflower florets to the bowl of sauce and stir with a large spoon until thoroughly coated with sauce. Remove each cauliflower floret from the bowl, one by one, (shake excess sauce if necessary), and roll in the panko breadcrumbs to coat (**see pro tip for this step below). Place each floret in an even layer on the baking sheet. The cauliflower should not be touching.

Bake for 30-35 minutes or until cooked throughout and crispy. Remove from heat.

To assemble the tacos, heat the white corn tortillas on a large dry skillet on both sides until warm. I usually do this in batches of 2. When ready, add a few pieces of baked cauliflower, and top with chopped green onions and red cabbage. Drizzle a little more Frank’s Red Hot and vegan ranch dressing, if desired.

This recipe makes 4 servings (2 tacos each). **Best served immediately. You can store in an airtight container in the fridge. To reheat, add cauliflower to a baking sheet covered in parchment paper, and bake at 400 F for 10-12 minutes, until warm.

fields.title: Duck Breasts with Sweet Chilli Tomato Jam
fields.intro: The king of meats - duck - combined with the sweet but sharp zing of a spicy tomato jam is a combination made in heaven!
fields.directions:
Pre-heat the oven to 180°C, fan 160°C, gas mark 4.

Score the fat on each duck breast and season well, then place the duck breasts skin side down into a large frying pan (without oil) on a medium heat and cook for about 8 minutes until the fat has rendered out and the skin has gone golden brown and crispy.

Turn the duck breasts over briefly to seal the flesh side, and then transfer to a roasting dish and place in the oven for 8 minutes.

Whilst the duck is roasting, pour away the fat from the frying pan and add 2tbsp of water and the sugar and bring to the boil. Add the garlic and chilli and continue to boil until it starts to thicken. Add the tomatoes and vinegar and cook for a further 2 minutes, season to taste and set aside.

Leave the duck breasts to rest for five minutes before carving, then arrange onto a plate, add the creme fraiche on top, drizzle over the chill jam and garnish with the fresh coriander.

Serve with a baby spinach and watercress salad.

fields.title: Jerusalem Artichoke and Spinach Soup
fields.intro: A warming year-round soup that is both quick and easy to prepare!
fields.directions:
Melt butter in a roomy pan, fry the onion until transparent but not brown.

Stir in the artichokes. Sweat the vegetables, covered, shaking from time to time, for about 10 minutes.

Pour in the stock and add pepper and salt plus some freshly ground nutmeg to taste (about half a nutmeg). Bring to boil and reduce heat, simmer gently, stirring often, for about 20-25 minutes, or until artichokes are really soft.

Rinse spinach leaves and discard stems. Add to soup and remove pan from hob. (Spinach will cook in the residual heat, and will retain its colour.)

Allow to cool a little, then reduce soup to purée. Stir in the milk (water) and then reheat gently without boiling. 

Serve hot, with slivered hazelnuts sprinkled on top.

fields.title: Moroccan Shepherds Pie
fields.intro: Nutritious, warming and interesting. This Moroccan take on a traditional British staple will leave you yearning for more.
fields.directions:
Boil the potatoes until cooked, drain, add the turmeric and mash adding butter and milk to make a smooth mash 

Meanwhile heat the oil and cook the shallots and garlic until softened

Add the mince to the pan and cook until it changes colour . 

Add the spices, wine, tomato purée and seasoning if wanted 

Simmer for 15 minutes 

Add the olives and coriander then transfer to an ovenproof dish. Spoon the potato topping onto it 

Bake in an oven at 200C for 20 mins

Toss the chunks of bread in some olive oil and sprinkle them over the surface of the potato.Drizzle with oil and  a little butter.

Return to oven for 15to 20 minutes until sizzling and golden.
fields.image_credit: irrational cat, CC BY-SA 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

fields.title: Rib Eye Steak and Feu Giratoire Salad
fields.intro: A great cut of beef surrounded by a bed of coloured lights!
fields.directions:
Heat the oven to max temp.

While oven is warming up, prepare the salads:
Coat each pepper with olive oil and set aside until oven is hot.
Finely chop and mix together the parsley and garlic and set aside.
Prepare a bed of crunchy salad to go underneath the steaks.

When oven is hot, place the peppers inside and roast for 15 minutes before turning over and roasting for another 15 minutes.
Remove the peppers from the oven, place in a bag and cool them quickly in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Once cool, remove from freezer and scrape off the skin, remove the seeds and stalk and slice the peppers, keepin each one separate.

For the steak:
While the peppers are cooling, rub the steaks with the salt, pepper and oregano.
Heat a pan with a knob of butter and fry the steaks on high heat for a minute each side. Then reduce heat and leave steaks to warm inside.
Once done, set steaks aside for 5 minutes.

Lay the steaks on the bed of salad.

Line the bed of salad with the red, yellow and green roasted peppers. Dress the peppers with the chopped parsley and garlic mix.

Great with new spuds!

Rub a little horseradish sauce on each side of the steak when set on the salad. If the horseradish sauce is freshly opened, mix it with a little sour cream to stop the sauce over-powering the salad flavours.

fields.title: Fish'n'Chips & Minted Mushy Peas
fields.intro: The traditional British take away. Recipes and Deliveries supply all the ingredients... its up to you if you serve it on a bed of old newspaper!
fields.directions:
For the batter, pour the beer into a large mixing bowl and gently whisk in the flour until you get a smooth and silky consistency (you may need to add more or less flour). Add cayenne, soy sauce and seasoning. Leave in the fridge till ready to use. This can be made an hour before needed.

To prepare the peas, heat half the butter in a saucepan and gently cook the onion until soft but not coloured. Add the peas, vegetable stock (a good quality cube is fine) and mint leaves and simmer for 10 minutes. Blend in a food processor, taking care to prevent it from becoming too smooth. Season. You can also prepare this in advance. Just before serving, reheat the peas and stir in the remaining butter.

For the chips, peel the potatoes and cut chips 1½cm wide and 7cm long. Wash the chips in water, drain on kitchen paper and pat dry. Pour the oil into a heavy-bottomed saucepan or deep fat fryer.

Heat to 120C. If using a heavy-bottomed saucepan, please be careful as the oil will be very hot. Blanch the chips, 2 or 3 handfuls at a time, until they are soft but not coloured. You can test them with a knife by carefully removing one while cooking to see if it is soft. Once ready, remove and drain.

Turn up the deep fat fryer to 160C. Season and lightly flour the fish, dip into the batter and fry in the hot fat. This will take about 8 minutes. Drain and keep warm. Re-fry the chips until crisp. Season lightly with salt. Spoon the mushy peas onto plates, place the fish on top and serve chips on the side.

fields.title: Daube de Boeuf Provençal
fields.intro: Daube: A classic Provençal (or more broadly, French) stew made with stewing steak braised in wine, vegetables, garlic, and herbes de Provence.
fields.directions:
Place the cinnamon stick, orange zest, bay leaf, thyme, parsley, peppercorns, cloves, and celery leaves onto a single layer of cheesecloth. Tie the cheesecloth up to make a bouquet garni, and set it aside.

Gently toss together the celery, onions, garlic, carrots, beef, bacon, and bouquet garni in a large, non-reactive dish. Pour the wine and Cognac over the mixture and refrigerate it for 12 to 24 hours.

Preheat the oven to 325 F. Remove the beef from the vegetables – reserving the vegetable mixture - and allow it to drain onto clean kitchen towels. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Toss the beef with the flour and brown it in the hot oil. Remove the beef from the skillet and deglaze the pan with the beef stock and tomato paste, scraping up the browned bits from the bottom of the pan.

Combine the beef, pan sauce, olives, salt, and the vegetable-wine mixture in a large ovenproof dish and cover. Braise the beef for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, until the beef is tender. Check to see if there is too much liquid in the pan about 2 hours into the cooking time. If you want a thicker stew, remove the lid for the remainder of the cooking time.

Cook the rice according to package directions. Remove the bouquet garni and serve the stew, garnished with the chopped parsley, over hot, cooked rice.

This daube de boeuf Provencal recipe makes 6-8 servings.

fields.title: Pepperoni, mozzarella, olive and basil pizza
fields.intro: Get dinner on the table in a jiffy with this easy pizza recipe. Versatile and quick, this is a pizza recipe that can cater to all tastes.
fields.directions:
Preheat the oven to 220˚C

Lightly grease a pizza tray by spraying it with olive oil.

Spread the pizza base with the tomato paste and scatter grated mozzarella over the top.

Scatter pepperoni and place the pizza in the oven for 10 - 12 minutes, until cheese is melted.

Remove the pizza from the oven and add, olives, basil leaves and parmesan.

Cut into wedges and serve immediately!

fields.title: Creamy Chicken Curry
fields.intro: This quick and easy chicken curry is creamy, full of flavour and takes less than half an hour!
fields.directions:
Thinly slice the spring onions, reserving a handful of the sliced green parts for garnish. Peel and chop the garlic. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat and cook the spring onions and garlic for a few minutes. Add the tomatoes, curry powder and ground ginger and cook for 3-4 minutes. If the pan gets dry add a splash of water and make sure the spices don't burn.

Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Make sure all the chicken is coated and is beginning to brown on the sides.

Add 250ml/9fl oz water and bring to the boil. Reduce to a medium to low heat and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through with no sign of pink juices in the middle of the pieces.

While the chicken is cooking, prepare the rice. Pour the rice into a saucepan and rinse it under the cold tap to take away any cloudy starch. Drain the cloudy water away. Add clean water for cooking the rice. You need almost twice as much water as rice. (If you use a mug of rice, add a little less than two mugs of water). Bring to the boil then reduce the heat to a low simmer. Cover with a lid and cook very gently for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and leave to stand with the lid on for 10 minutes. This will finish cooking the rice. Keeping the lid on is important, so none of the steam escapes.

Take the curry off the heat, stir in the yoghurt then season with salt and pepper. Serve the curry with the rice and garnish with a drizzle of yoghurt.

fields.name: cayenne pepper sauce + more for dressing tacos
Greek-style natural yoghurt + more to garnish
